summary: This bill, the "Restoring the Armed Career Criminal Act," amends Title 18 of the United States Code, relating to sentencing of armed career criminals. It modifies Section 924 to clarify the types of offenses that trigger enhanced sentencing for repeat offenders, specifically those who violate section 922(g) (relating to possession of firearms by prohibited persons). The bill increases minimum prison sentences for those with three or more prior serious felony convictions and defines "serious felony conviction." It applies to offenses committed after the bill's enactment and doesn't allow for challenges to existing sentences.
